model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!
Co-workers B: That's awesome! I didn't know you sang.
Co-workers A: Yeah, it's something I've always loved to do but haven't had the chance to do it in a while.
Co-workers B: Well, it sounds like you did a great job. What did you sing?
Co-workers A: I sang "Amazing Grace". It's always been one of my favorites.
Co-workers B: That's such a beautiful song. You have a great voice.
Co-workers A: Thank you! It was really nerve-wracking, but I'm glad I did it.
Co-workers B: I'm sure the audience loved it. You've really got some talent.
Co-workers A: Thanks again. It's just something I do for fun, but it's nice to know people enjoy it.
Co-workers B: Definitely. It's great to have a hobby like that. Reminds me of when you uncovered that mystery a while back. You always seem to surprise us with your skills.
Co-workers A: Haha, yeah. I do like a good challenge. Speaking of surprises, remember when I found out you were married? That was a shocker.
Co-workers B: Oh gosh, yes. I forget sometimes that not everyone knows. But yeah, I've been married for a few years now.
Co-workers A: Crazy how time flies. Like when we found out Ms. Singh was leaving our school. I still can't believe that was two years ago.
Co-workers B: I know, right? She was such a great teacher. Speaking of which, have you heard anything about her lately?
Co-workers A: Not really. I think she moved to another state, but I'm not sure where.
Co-workers B: Ah, okay. Well, hopefully she's doing well wherever she is. But hey, getting back to your solo, I think you should definitely do it again sometime.
Co-workers A: Really? You think so?
Co-workers B: Absolutely. You've got a gift, and it would be a shame not to use it.

[MEMORY]
[Co-worker A and Co-worker B are excited about payday and being able to pay off bills.] - (React) - [Co-worker A suggests celebrating their detective work with drinks after work.]
[Co-worker A discovered that an employee was hiding clothes to sell on the side.] - (SameTopic) - [Co-worker A is observant and did some research on social media to find out that Co-worker B is married.]
[Co-worker B mentions that their store is getting new inventory next week, specifically a new line of athletic wear.] - (Want) - [Co-worker A enjoys solving puzzles and mysteries, even considering becoming a detective.]

The dialogue context is mostly about Co-worker A's recent experience of singing at church and Co-worker B's inquiries about Ms. Singh. The memory, on the other hand, revolves around Co-worker A's detective skills, their knowledge about Co-worker B's marriage, and upcoming store inventory which isn't referred in the dialogue context.
